choices.name: AmInGoodStanding
choices.choiceText: I, the applicant, being a legal entity am in good standing and operating in accordance with the laws of the State(s) or Tribe where I, the Applicant, have a place of business.

choices.name: AmNotInGoodStanding
choices.choiceText: I, the applicant, being a legal entity am not in good standing and operating in accordance with the laws of the State(s) or Tribe where I, the Applicant, have a place of business

choices.name: Costs_of_less_than_200_000_but_more_than_80_000
choices.choiceText: Costs of less than $200,000 but more than $80,000

value.stringValue: Costs of less than $200,000 but more than $80,000

choices.name: HAVE
choices.choiceText: I, the applicant, have received any grants and/or guaranteed loans under the REAP program.﻿

choices.name: HaveNot
choices.choiceText: I, the applicant, have not, received any grants and/or guaranteed loans under the REAP program.

choices.name: KnownRelationship
choices.choiceText: This is to certify that I, as the Applicant, have a known relationship or association with a Rural Development

choices.name: Native_Hawaiian_or_Other_Pacific_Islander
choices.choiceText: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

value.stringValue: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

choices.name: NoKnownRelationship
choices.choiceText: This is to certify that I, as the Applicant, have no known relationship or association with a Rural Development employee.

choices.name: NotApplicableGoodStanding
choices.choiceText: Not applicable, I am applying as a sole proprietor.

choices.name: Total_Project_Costs_of_200_000_and_greater
choices.choiceText: Total Project Costs of $200,000 and greater

value.stringValue: Total Project Costs of $200,000 and greater

choices.name: Total_Project_Costs_of_80_000_or_less
choices.choiceText: Total Project Costs of $80,000 or less

value.stringValue: Total Project Costs of $80,000 or less

choices.name: Total_Project_Costs_of_less_than_200_000_but_more_than_80_000
choices.choiceText: Total Project Costs of less than $200,000 but more than $80,000

fields.name: xvi_Attach_the_following_if_not_already_submitted
fields.fieldText: xvi. Attach the following if not already submitted

fields.name: Renewable_Energy_Resource_documentationAttachment
fields.fieldText: Renewable Energy Resource documentation (if not included in vendor/installer certification).

fields.name: RES_historical_utility_billsAttachment
fields.fieldText: RES Replacement-Minimum of 12 months historical utility bills

fields.name: RES_Rate_Energy_Quantity_documentationAttachment
fields.fieldText: RES Rate & Energy Quantity documentation: PPA/Net metering or crediting policies/Letter from Utility.

fields.name: Energy_Audit_or_Energy_AssessmentAttachment
fields.fieldText: Energy Audit or Energy Assessment with a minimum of 12 months historical utility bills.

fields.name: Feasibility_Study_Attachment
fields.fieldText: Feasibility Study, as necessary, for Renewable Energy System projects.

fields.name: NameofRelationship
fields.fieldText: If there is a known relationship, please indicate the name of the Rural Development employee:

fields.name: Explain_previous_funding
fields.fieldText: If grants or guaranteed loans have been received, identify each grant and/or guaranteed loan, date received, and describe the progress that has been made on each project, including projected schedules and actual completions dates, if applicable:

fields.name: CertifyDisplayText
fields.fieldText: The Applicant certifies to each of the following by checking the box below. (The Agency reserves the right to request additional information to substantiate the certifications(s).)

fields.name: CertificationA
fields.fieldText: A. The applicant meets each of the applicant eligibility criteria found in 7 C.F.R. 4280.112.

fields.name: CertificationB
fields.fieldText: B. The proposed project meets each of the project eligibility requirements found in 7 C.F.R. 4280.113.

fields.name: CertificationC
fields.fieldText: C. Per 7 C.F.R. 4280.113, the applicant acknowledges caution against taking any actions or incurring any obligations prior to the Agency’s environmental review that limits the range of alternatives or has an adverse effect on the environment, such initiation of construction. If taken, it could result in project ineligibility.

fields.name: CertificationD
fields.fieldText: D. The applicant meets the criteria for submitting an application for projects with Total Project Costs of $80,000 or less.

fields.name: CertificationE
fields.fieldText: E. The applicant or the applicant’s prime contractor assumes all risk and responsibilities of project development, including interim financing, including during construction. The applicant is solely responsible for the execution of all contracts, and Agency review and approval is not required.

fields.name: CertificationF
fields.fieldText: F. Construction planning and performing development will be performed in compliance with 7 C.F.R. 4280.120(c).

fields.name: CertificationG
fields.fieldText: G. The applicant agrees not to request reimbursement from funds obligated under this program until after the project has been completed and is operating in accordance with the information provided in the application for the project.

fields.name: CertificationH
fields.fieldText: H. The applicant will maintain insurance coverage as required under 7 C.F.R. 4280.123 (b).

fields.name: Certification_i
fields.fieldText: I. The design, engineering, testing, and monitoring will be sufficient to demonstrate that the proposed project will meet its intended purpose.

fields.name: CertificationJ
fields.fieldText: J. The equipment required for the project is available, can be procured and delivered within the proposed project development schedule, and will be installed in conformance with manufacturer’s specifications and design requirements. This would not be applicable when equipment is not part of the project.

fields.name: CertificationK
fields.fieldText: K. The project will be constructed in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, agreements, permits, codes, and standards.

fields.name: CertificationL
fields.fieldText: L. The applicant will abide by the open and free competition requirements in compliance with 7 C.F.R. 4280.125(a)(1).

fields.name: CertificationM
fields.fieldText: M. The applicant will abide by the equal employment opportunity requirements in compliance with 7 C.F.R. 4280.125(a)(2).

fields.name: CertificationN
fields.fieldText: N. For bioenergy projects only, that any and all woody biomass feedstock from National Forest System land or public lands cannot be used as a higher value wood-based product.

fields.name: CertificationAndAcceptanceSection
fields.fieldText: xvii. Certification of Documentation and Acceptance:

fields.name: CertificationAndAcceptanceDisplayText
fields.fieldText: CERTIFICATION AND ACCEPTANCE I certify that, to the best of my knowledge and belief, the information included with this Application, including all attachments, are true and correct, and that I certify to each of the conditions specified in Section XII-XVI of this application. AGRICULTURAL PRODUCER \ RURAL SMALL BUSINESS

fields.name: CommitmentofFundsDisplayText
fields.fieldText: Commitment of Funds: Documentation is required to be attached for points under the commitment of funds scoring criteria.

screens.name: Energy_Efficiency_Improvement_Projects_Technical_Requirement
screens.label: Energy Efficiency Improvement Projects - Technical Requirements:

fields.name: TechnicalRequirementDisplayText
fields.fieldText:
Technical Requirements: Prepare technical report in accordance with 7 C.F.R. 4280.120 (b) (3). (If project is a Renewable Energy System, go to Block VIII.)


1. Provide a vendor/installer certification that:


a. the EEI meets the requirements for being commercially available;


b. the EEI system will operate and perform over the project’s useful life in a reliable and cost-effective manner,


c. the vendor/installer is qualified to complete the project as intended, noting the number of years experience with the proposed EEI technology.

value.stringValue: Technical Certification or Report (as applicable) attached

fields.name: EnergyAssessmentDisplaytext
fields.fieldText: 2. Provide energy assessment (or energy audit) as required under Section C of Appendix A and qualifications of person or entity completing the audit/assessment. Energy Assessment or Energy Audit (as applicable) attached

fields.name: EnergyAssessmentorAudit
fields.fieldText: A. Existing usage as per Energy Assessment or Energy Audit:

fields.name: ProposedUsageDisplayText
fields.fieldText: B. Proposed (estimated) usage following completion of the project as per Energy Assessment or Energy Audit:

fields.name: Total_Energy_SavingsCalculation
fields.helpText: Calculation: Total BTU Existing -  Total BTU Proposed = Total BTU Savings

fields.name: D_Percent_Energy_SavingsCalculation
fields.helpText: Calculation: Total BTU Savings / Total BTU Exsiting = % Savings

fields.name: E_Dollar_SavingsCalculation
fields.helpText: Calculation: Total Existing Energy Cost - = Dollars Saved

fields.name: F_EEI_Simple_Payback
fields.helpText: Calculation: (Total project costs (D 1 b) $ / = years F. annual energy savings value (Vlll E.) $

fields.name: EnvironmentalBenefitsDisplayText
fields.fieldText: Environmental Benefits: Please provide a detailed narrative or analysis where applicable to support the project's impact on the following:

fields.name: A_Will_the_project_convert_farmland_and_if_so_how_many_acres
fields.fieldText: A. Will the project convert farmland and if so, how many acres?

fields.name: B_Will_the_project_contribute_to_deforestation_or_address_fire_hazards_on_forest
fields.fieldText: B. Will the project contribute to deforestation or address fire hazards on forest lands?

fields.name: C_Will_the_project_conserve_water_and_if_so_how_much
fields.fieldText: C. Will the project conserve water and if so, how much?

fields.name: D_Does_the_project_comply_with_the_Environmental_Protection_Agency_s_renewable_f
fields.fieldText: D. Does the project comply with the Environmental Protection Agency's renewable fuel standards?

fields.name: E_Are_at_least_25_percent_of_the_project_components_biobased
fields.fieldText: E. Are at least 25 percent of the project components biobased?

fields.name: FinancialInformationDisplaytext
fields.fieldText: Financial Information: For projects with total project costs of $200,000 or more, attach required financial information for the total operation and all entity(ies) it controls or is controlled by. If business assets are held personally, prepare financials using only the assets and liabilities attributable to the business.

fields.name: HistoricalFinancialStatements
fields.fieldText: A. Historical Financial Statements for the past three years:

fields.name: ProformaBalanceSheet
fields.fieldText: Pro Forma Balance Sheet at Start-up of Operation (include grant award or loan proceeds):

fields.name: ProjectInformation
fields.fieldText: Project Information: The REAP Federal grant share is up to a maximum of 25% unless the project meets one of the following criteria: a) is located in a designated energy community; b) is proposed by a Tribal entity; c) is an energy efficiency improvement project; or d) is a renewable energy system or retrofit of a renewable energy system that produces zero greenhouse gas emissions (GHGE) at the project level. Identify the type of energy project to be funded, supported by attached energy assessment or audit, technical report or vendor certification, or feasibility study as applicable.

fields.name: HybridDisplayText
fields.fieldText: Hybrid (two or more technologies supporting a single system), select technologies above and describe how they work together to support a single system:

fields.name: ProjectDescrtiption
fields.fieldText: Provide a detailed description of the technology and its intended purpose (energy replacement, netmetered, sold, self-use energy), the project location (address) and the specific site of the project at the project location. Describe utility relationships (interconnection, net metering, power purchase agreements, etc.) and attach agreements to document established rates to be paid for energy being sold or replaced.

fields.name: ProjectCostBreakdown
fields.fieldText: Construction Item: (Break down total project costs by providing a list of major equipment, labor costs, fees, and other costs associated with the project. Provide useful life information on major system components. Detailed bids may be attached to support total project costs.):

fields.name: ProjectCostsDisplayText
fields.fieldText:
B. Total Project Costs:

(Total Project Costs should be the same as in Form SF-424C, “Budget Information-Construction Programs.”)

fields.name: Eligible_Project_Costs
fields.fieldText: C. Eligible Project Costs: (See Instructions to determine eligible project costs.

fields.name: IneligibelProjectCost
fields.fieldText: D. In-Eligible Project Costs: Provide details for any known in-eligible project costs, including but not limited to, down payments made prior to date of application or the prorated portion of residential related renewable energy system costs.

fields.name: EstimatedProjectEnergyGeneration
fields.fieldText: 2. Estimated Project Energy Generation or Savings and Cost of Energy. The Agency may request additional information to substantiate energy quantity, units, and rates if necessary.

fields.name: RenewableEnergyGeneratedDisplayText
fields.fieldText:
i. Annual amount of renewable energy to be generated and unit of energy:

-Attach Vendor/Installer certified projections, renewable energy site assessment,

or other documentation to validate the total amount of energy to be generated,

including the quality and availability of the renewable resource to the project.

fields.name: DocumentedUseDisplayText
fields.fieldText:
ii. Documented use (renewable energy sold, 

metered/credited, or for direct-use, unit of measurement, 

price per unit, dollar value and name of utility/offtaker, as 

applicable. 

-Attach power purchase agreement to document 

quantity of energy sales and price/unit to be paid for 

energy. 


 -Attach utility net metering, virtual net metering, energy 

crediting policies or agreements, or letter from utility 

which shows rate to be paid for excess energy. 


Direct Use Energy: 

 - Must have at least 12 months of historical energy use 

to score as replacement. Attach at least 12 months 

of utility bills to document average historical price paid 

for direct use replacement energy; 

When calculating the actual average price per unit 

of energy, only include energy charges directly reduced 

by the unit of energy being replaced or saved, e.g. do 

not include monthly service fees, demand or other 

charges if not directly reduced; or 


 -Attach documentation of conventional energy price for 

direct use new construction or off-grid applications.

fields.name: ByProductOtherRevenueDisplayText
fields.fieldText:
iii. By-product/other revenue quantity , description, unit of measurement, documented fair market price per unit,

and dollar value:


-Do not include government or utility incentives or renewable energy credits

that will not be received annually for the life of the project.


-Attach documentation on quantity and price of byproduct/other revenue.

fields.name: HistoricalAnnualAverageDisplayText
fields.fieldText:
iv. Historical annual average energy used by business, unit of measurement, average retail price historically paid per unit, and dollar value:

-Attach at least 12 months of utility bills to document average historical price paid for business energy.


When calculating the actual average price per unit of energy, only include energy charges directly reduced

by the unit of energy being replaced or saved, e.g. do not include monthly service fees, demand or other

charges if not directly reduced.

fields.name: HistoricalResidentialEnergyDisplayText
fields.fieldText:
v. If RES project will be connected to a shared meter that connects both the business and a residence, or if the project will virtually net meter or credit energy to be generated by the RES project to a residence off-site from the project, yet owned by the applicant, provide amount of historical residential energy use and unit of measurement:

- Attach annual residential energy use summary with a detailed list of assumptions.


Note: 50% or more of projected renewable energy to be generated must benefit the business operation in order for the project to be eligible. Eligible project costs are prorated based on historical business energy consumption.


A separate meter may also be installed.

fields.name: C_A_separate_meter_will_be_installed
fields.fieldText: C. A separate meter will be installed

fields.name: ApplicationTitle
fields.fieldText:
U.S. DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE

Rural Development – Rural Business-Cooperative Service

RURAL ENERGY FOR AMERICA PROGRAM APPLICATION FOR RENEWABLE ENERGY SYSTEMS AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS

fields.name: PrivacyDisclosure
fields.fieldText:
NOTE: The following statement is made in accordance with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 USC 552a) and the Paperwork Act of 1995, as amended. The authority for requesting the following information is Section 9007 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 (Public Law 113-79). This information may be provided to other agencies, Internal Revenue Service, Department of Justice, or other State and Federal law enforcement agencies, and in response to a court magistrate or administrative tribunal. The provisions of criminal and civil fraud statutes, including 18 USC 286, 287, 371, 641, 1001; 1014, 15 USC 714m; and 31 USC 3729, may be applicable to the information provided.


SUBMIT THIS COMPLETED FORM TO THE USDA RURAL DEVELOPMENT OFFICE IN THE STATE IN WHICH THE PROJECT IS LOCATED.


Attached to this form are detailed Instructions for each section. Please refer to the Instructions for guidance when completing this form. Use attachments as necessary.

fields.name: What_is_Applicant_s_race_check_all_that_apply
fields.fieldText: **i. B.What is Applicant’s race (check all that apply)?

fields.name: Is_Applicant_a_member_of_a_Socially_Disadvantaged_group
fields.fieldText: i.F. Is Applicant a member of a Socially Disadvantaged group?

fields.name: Antidiscrimination_Disclosure
fields.fieldText: ** The purpose of these questions is to gather race, ethnicity, and gender information about persons who apply and participate in this USDA program. The information provided will not be used when reviewing the application or when determining eligibility to participate in this program. The answers provided are voluntary and are not required to be considered a complete application. The information provided will be used to improve the operation of this program, to help USDA design additional opportunities for program participation, and to monitor enforcement of laws that require equal access to this program for eligible persons. For entities, check all that apply. The information will be kept private to the extent permitted by law.

fields.name: SAMiD
fields.fieldText: System for Awards Management (SAM) Registration: Provide a Unique Entity Identifier (UEI) number upon successful SAM registration.

fields.name: ProvideNamesofExecs
fields.fieldText: Provide the name(s) for the Executive Director and person(s) who will be accepting or distributing Federal funds.

fields.name: Name_s_of_Executive
fields.helpText: Provide the name(s) for the Executive Director and person(s) on separate lines.

fields.name: ApplicantTypeCertification
fields.fieldText:
Type of Applicant (check one):

Applicant must certify to meeting the definition of either an Agricultural Producer or Rural Small Business, per 7 C.F.R. 4280.103

fields.name: Applicant_Type
fields.fieldText: A. Applicant is applying as and hereby certifies to meeting the definition of (check one):

fields.name: NAICSCODEDisplayText
fields.fieldText: B. Provide primary North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for operation:

fields.name: ApplicantDescriptionQuestions
fields.fieldText: Applicant Description: Describe the ownership of the applicant, including:

fields.name: The_project_s_relationship_to_the_applicant_s_operations_Describe_how_the_prop
fields.fieldText: A. The project’s relationship to the applicant’s operations. Describe how the proposed project fits into or operates separately from the applicant’s overall business or agricultural production operation:

fields.name: Describe_how_the_applicant_at_the_time_of_application_award_and_through_the_us
fields.fieldText: B. Describe how the applicant, at the time of application, award, and through the useful life, owns the project and owns or controls the site for the project:

fields.name: For_each_entity_ies_the_applicant_controls_or_entity_ies_it_is_controlled_by_p
fields.fieldText: C. For each entity(ies) the applicant controls or entity(ies) it is controlled by, provide a list of the owners with their contact information. Describe the relationship between the applicant and the other entity(ies), including percent of ownership and control, management, passive investor ownership and any products exchanged. Organizational charts should be submitted when available:

fields.name: Advise_if_the_applicant_is_a_Tribal_entity_describe_the_location_of_the_projec
fields.fieldText: D. Advise if the applicant is a Tribal entity, describe the location of the project and whether it will be located on Tribal Lands.

fields.name: Application_Disclosure
fields.fieldText:
A federal agency may not conduct or sponsor, and a person is not required to respond to, nor shall a person be subject to a penalty for failure to comply with a collection of information subject to the requirements of the Paperwork Reduction Act unless that collection of information displays a currently valid OMB Control Number. The OMB Control Number for this information collection is 0570-0067. Public reporting for this collection of information is estimated to be approximately 10 hours per response, including the time for reviewing instructions, searching existing data sources, gathering and maintaining the data needed, completing and reviewing the collection of information.

All responses to this collection of information are voluntary, however in order to obtain or retain a benefit the information in this form is required. Rural Development has no plans to publish information collected under the provisions of this program. Send comments regarding this burden estimate or any other aspect of this collection of information, including suggestions for reducing this burden to: Information Collection Clearance Officer, Rural Development Innovation Center, Regulations Management Division at ICRMTRequests@usda.gov

fields.name: TechnicalRequirementsDisplayText
fields.fieldText: Technical Requirements: Prepare technical report in accordance with 7 C.F.R. 4280.120 (b) (4). *If Hybrid project, submit specific technical information for each technology. If project includes one of the following renewable energy technologies, or a technology as amended in via Federal Register publication, a full technical report is not required: solar, wind, micro-hydro, and geothermal direct use. (For Energy Efficiency Improvement Projects Complete Block IX.)

fields.name: VendorInstallerCertification
fields.fieldText:
1. Provide a vendor/installer certification that:


a. the RES project meets the requirements for being commercially available;


b. the RES system will operate and perform over the project’s useful life in a reliable and cost-effective manner, noting associated warranties;


c. the vendor/installer is qualified to complete the project as intended, noting the number of similar systems installed and any professional credentials, licenses and relevant experience; and


d. includes a resource assessment with certified projections on energy to be replaced and/or generated once the proposed system is operating at its steady state operating level, including the quality and availability of the renewable resources to the project. The assessment should include if applicable, historical residential energy use documentation, per section VI(D)(2)(a)(v)).

fields.name: Feasibility_study_for_project_has_been_conducted_and_is_attached_to_support_the
fields.fieldText: Feasibility study for project has been conducted and is attached to support the project.

fields.name: ProvidersAndQualifications
fields.fieldText: G. Qualifications of Service Providers. Provide information on personnel and companies that will be working to construct and install the project, such as: energy auditor, site assessor, contractor, installer, electrician, etc.

fields.name: QualificationsProvider
fields.fieldText: Qualifications (Either attach a resume or complete below):

fields.name: Number_performed_on_a_similar_system_as_proposed
fields.fieldText: Number performed on a similar system as proposed

fields.name: Professional_credentialsProvider
fields.fieldText: Professional credentials (include training and/or education related to work, certificates, etc.)
